vague_description: Determine the optimal quantity of fish and chicken meals needed to satisfy dietary requirements while minimizing fat intake.
detailed_description: A doctor recommends her patient eat more fish and chicken to increase her \param{ProteinFish} and \param{IronFish} intake. Each fish meal contains \param{ProteinFish} units of protein and \param{IronFish} units of iron. Each chicken meal contains \param{ProteinChicken} units of protein and \param{IronChicken} units of iron. The patient needs to consume at least \param{MinProtein} units of protein and \param{MinIron} units of iron. Since the chicken meal is less expensive, the patient prefers to consume at least \param{MinChickenFishRatio} times as many chicken meals as fish meals. If each fish meal contains \param{FatFish} units of fat and each chicken meal contains \param{FatChicken} units of fat, how many meals of each should she eat to minimize her fat intake?
target_objective: Minimize the total fat intake from consuming fish and chicken meals
target_constraints: Patient needs at least MinProtein units of protein
Patient needs at least MinIron units of iron
The number of fish meals is non-negative
The number of chicken meals is non-negative
target_parameters: Units of protein in each fish meal
Units of iron in each fish meal
Units of protein in each chicken meal
Units of iron in each chicken meal
Minimum ratio of chicken meals to fish meals
Units of fat in each fish meal
Units of fat in each chicken meal
